Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an invasion of the right to free speech.
The ACMA's role in determining misinformation is perceived as biased due to government appointment.
The legislation is compared to a social credit system similar to China's, suggesting a loss of freedoms.
Concerns about the legislation being part of a broader agenda involving Digital IDs and restricted movement.
Notable Quotes: I consider the very notion of monitoring people's expressed views and information to be an invasion on our right to free speech.
This is merely legislative course to initiate a social credit score for Australia as the CCP has already done so in China.
This is a totalitarian dictatorship delivered to us by the foreign power of the World Economic Forum.
